details.title: Rajasthan to begin rapid antigen tests to check coronavirus spread
details.content:
• The Rajasthan government will soon begin rapid antigen tests on a trial basis for screening coronavirus cases in the state as per guidelines issued by the ICMR.
  • Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot gave this direction to officials during a video conference with medical experts, the statement said.
  • Additional Chief Secretary, Medical and Health, Rohit Kumar Singh said the ICMR is sending 200 test kits to Rajasthan for the trial.
  • Gehlot said this will help ramp up coronavirus investigation infrastructure and get quick reports.

(Inputs from PTI)

details.title: IN PICS | Joggers out in the capital despite skyrocketing COVID-19 cases
details.content:
Delhi: Joggers, morning walkers and cyclists carry out their exercises near India Gate. Maximum temperature of 38.6°C was recorded in the national capital yesterday, as per India Meteorological Department (IMD) data. pic.twitter.com/ZQcrNnYXYH

details.content:

details.title: Maharashtra records highest one-day spike in coronavirus cases at 5,024
details.content:

details.title: WATCH | Tamil Nadu 2nd worst-hit state in India as coronavirus tally nears 75,000
Lockdown not on cards in Bengaluru, government to ramp up testing
details.content:
The State government on Friday reiterated that it has no plans to shut down Bengaluru, and will ramp up testing capacity to fight the Covid-19 pandemic. With the number of cases in the capital increasing, the government has decided to increase the number of tests each day from 4,000 to 7,500, and also have swab testing facilities in all assembly segments in Bengaluru.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

AFP graphic looking at countries with the highest #coronavirus death tolls, and their respective death rates @AFPgraphics pic.twitter.com/1FrKAzichR

— AFP news agency (@AFP) June 26, 2020

details.title: Body of 70-year-old shifted in JCB on suspicion of him being COVID-19 victim in Andhra
details.content:
In an inhuman act, the body of a 70-year-old man, who is said to be a COVID-19 victim, was shifted to the burial ground in an earth mover in Palasa on Friday. According to information, the septuagenarian died on Thursday night with suspected symptoms of coronavirus.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: AAP forms 1,100 teams to conduct house-to-house screening, collect data
details.content:
The Delhi government has formed at least 1,100 teams to conduct a mega exercise to screen the national capital’s population for COVIDd-19, revenue department officials said on Friday. The process of screening every household, which has to be completed by July 6, has already started in the municipal wards of some districts.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: IN PICS | Vande Bharat Mission continues to bring stranded citizens home
details.content:
#VandeBharatMission: A special Air India flight for repatriation of stranded Indian nationals leaves from Paris Charles de Gaulle airport for Kochi, Kerala pic.twitter.com/5mCnfnTsqy

— ANI (@ANI) June 27, 2020

details.title: Kerala | More than 1,000 new cases in 8 days; 6 CISF personnel positive
details.content:
Kerala reported 100-plus Covid-19 cases for the eighth straight day, adding more than 1,000 persons to the list of active cases during the period. With another four days to complete five months since the first case was reported, on January 30, the state now has 1,849 people under treatment. A total of 150 new cases were reported on Friday.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Mumbai | Google forms to be issued for recording COVID-19 deaths, says BMC
details.content:
There will be a new system of reporting COVID-19 deaths on a Google Form from 01.07.2020. Nodal Officers of the Hospital are directed to ensure death reporting within 48 hours from their hospitals from 01.07.2020 onwards: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation. (Inputs from ANI)

(Photo | EPS)

details.title: Coronavirus outbreak: Here is why steroid could be lowering mortality
details.content:
An observational research by doctors at a tertiary care hospital in Mumbai said methylprednisolone, a glucosteroid, helped them cure six out of seven serious COVID patients who had low oxygenation saturation levels — a sign of the disease’s severity — apart from several other symptoms.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Won’t rule out community spread in Karnataka, says minister K Sudhakar
details.content:
With an increase in the number of people with neither travel nor contact history testing positive, Medical Education Minister Dr K Sudhakar told The New Indian Express that there could be cases of community spread, but it is not very notable.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Rahul targets Centre, PM for having no plan to defeat COVID-19, as cases surge past five lakh mark
details.content:
• Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday said the government has no plan to defeat the pandemic and Prime Minister Narendra Modi has surrendered as he refuses to fight coronavirus.
  • "Covid19 is spreading rapidly into new parts of the country. The Government Of India has no plan to defeat it," Gandhi tweeted.
  • Training his guns on Modi, he said, "PM is silent. He has surrendered and is refusing to fight the pandemic."

details.title: Mental health | COVID-19 triggering panic attacks, depression and suicides, say experts
details.content:

details.content: The number of confirmed coronavirus cases worldwide has risen by over 177,000 in the past 24 hours to 9.4 million and the death toll has topped 480,000, the World Health Organisation (WHO) said on Friday.

details.title: With Chennai's COVID positivity rate at 25%, experts say testing needs to be ramped up
details.content: Even as Covid cases in the city continues to spike up rapidly, testing has remained stagnant, reveals data from Greater Chennai Corporation (GCC). A simple comparison of details shows, while the total positivity rate in the city jumped by a whopping 19.35% from May 1 to June 19, the number of samples being tested increased only by about 2,000. (READ MORE)

details.title: Congress MLA from Maharashtra tests COVID-19 positive
details.content: A Congress MLA from Nanded district of Maharashtra tested coronavirus positive on Saturday morning, a top district official said. He was found infected days after a senior minister from Nanded recovered from the infection. (READ MORE)

details.title: UP to launch door-to-door screening in Noida, five other districts
details.content: With the spike in the number of Covid-19 cases, especially in Meerut division comprising Gautam Buddh Nagar and Ghaziabad of NCR along with four other districts, the state government is set to launch a door-to-door screening of people. (READ MORE)

details.title: '8 states contributed 85 per cent COVID-19 caseload, 87 per cent deaths'
details.content: Eight states, including Maharashtra, Delhi and Tamil Nadu, contributed 85.5 per cent of the active COVID-19 caseload and 87 per cent of the total deaths due to the disease in India, according to the Union Health Ministry. (READ MORE)

details.content: Yesterday one of the staff working at Chief Minister Office tested positive for COVID-19. I immediately ordered closure of office and sanitization is being done. I request everyone to not come to my office for at least two days. I've also informed the speaker about it: Puducherry CM.

details.title: With 5,318 new cases, Maharashtra breaks records of one-day spike
details.content:
• Maharashtra on Saturday registered the highest-ever single-day spike of 5,318 new COVID-19 cases, state Health department said. The state's total case count now stands at 1,59,133.
  • With 167 deaths, the fatality count has gone up to 7,273, it said. Of the 167 deaths, 86 people died in the last 48 hours. Saturday's spike in cases has surpassed the record 5,024 detections recorded on Friday.
  • With 4,430 patientsbeing dischargedin the day, the number of the recovered cases mounted to 84,245, a Health official said. A total of 8,96,874 people have beentested so far.

details.content: West Bengal records 521 new COVID-19 positive cases and 13 deaths, taking the total number of cases in the State to 16,711 and death toll to 629. Number of active cases stands at 5,293.

details.title: Lockdown relaxed in Haryana
details.content: Except in containment areas, all type of activities will be allowed in Dehradun between 5 AM and 8 PM every day from June 29, says Dehradun the District Magistrate in an order.

details.title: 45 new cases in Jharkhand
details.content: 45 new COVID-19 cases recorded in Jharkhand today, taking the total number of cases to 2,339 including 1,724 recoveries.

details.title: Latest Haryana tally
details.content: 543 new COVID-19 positive cases reported in Haryana today, taking the total number of positive cases to 13,427. A total of 8472 people have recovered/discharged till date. The total death toll rises to 218

Punjab: Border Security Force troops continue to perform beating retreat ceremony at Attari-Wagah border near Amritsar, in absence of spectators. Constable Dharmanand Bhat says,"Spectators aren't permitted due to #COVID19 but we perform the ceremony with the same zeal & fervour." pic.twitter.com/5exjE2L0Gm

— ANI (@ANI) June 27, 2020

details.title: Lockdown in Madurai for three days
details.content: Madurai District Collector issues an order for complete lockdown from June 27 to 6 AM of June 29 in the district; milk delivery, hospitals, pharmacies and other emergency services to be allowed.

details.title: Karnataka's new quarantine rule
details.content: People coming from Maharashtra will be placed in seven-day institutional quarantine followed by seven-day home quarantine in Karnataka. People coming from other states will need to undergo 14-day home quarantine.

details.title: Update from Bhubaneswar
details.content:
The area from Trinath temple to Biju Patnaik International Airport Boundary is declared as containment zone. @NewIndianXpress @XpressOdisha @bmcbbsr #Bhubaneswar pic.twitter.com/9sP7BnUdpu

— Tanmay Das (@tanmay__das) June 27, 2020

Maharashtra: Barber shops & salons gear up to reopen from June 28 in Mumbai. Shahid Hussain, a salon owner, says, "We will record customers' temperatures & provide them with hand sanitisers when they enter our shop. We will use new towel & haircut seat for each customer." pic.twitter.com/BWEAqLCpY6

— ANI (@ANI) June 27, 2020

details.title: Arunachal bars entry of returnees for two days
details.content:
Entry of returnees from outside Arunachal Pradesh shall be suspended b/w July 1&July 3 except the emergent cases & exempted categories as per MHA’s order. Registration shall resume at State Quarantine Centre in Lekhi&hotels from July 4:Deputy Commissioner,Itanagar capital region pic.twitter.com/49oImyS8ce

— ANI (@ANI) June 27, 2020

details.title: Update from Karnataka
details.content:
• Karnataka Government issues an order, directing private hospitals not to deny treatment to patients with COVID-19 and COVID-19 like symptoms.
  • "Non-compliance of this order will attract punishment under sections of Disaster Management Act 2005," the order reads.

details.title: 57 new cases in Chhattisgarh today
details.content: 57 COVID-19 cases and 52 discharged reported in Chhattisgarh today. Total number of cases in the state is now at 2,602, including 652 active cases, 1,937 discharged, & 13 deaths: State Health Department

details.title: WATCH | Karnataka news bulletin
details.content:
K'taka recorded the single highest day spike of 918 covid positive cases. Among which Bluru Urban had 596 cases. From July 5: Sundays will be a complete lockdown and night curfew from June 28. @iffathfathima6 and @vinodkumart5
bring you updates#TNIEUpdatesoncovid19@santwana99 pic.twitter.com/WMcMFJSq67

— TNIE Karnataka (@XpressBengaluru) June 27, 2020

details.title: 31 Assam cops test COVID-19 positive
details.content:
A Superintendent of Police (SP) rank officer of Assam Police and 30 other ranks have tested #COVID19 positive. All are in good health: GP Singh, Additional Director General of Police (Law and Order) Assam pic.twitter.com/uIzZ5lu7Pk

— ANI (@ANI) June 27, 2020

details.title: 246 new cases in Assam
details.content: 246 COVID-19 cases reported in Assam yesterday, as of 11:45 PM. Total number of cases in the state is now at 7,165, including 4,814 discharged, 2,338 active cases & 10 deaths: Himanta Biswa Sarma, State Health Minister.

details.title: Apple growers in Shimla face lockdown woes
details.content:
Shimla: Apple growers facing labour shortage ahead of plucking season due to COVID19. Digvijay, an apple grower says,"Transportation services have not been restored properly, labourers are finding it tough to come.Many labourers come from Nepal, they are also facing difficulties" pic.twitter.com/vwY79n00ut

— ANI (@ANI) June 27, 2020

details.title: India reports highest single-day spike of 19,906 new cases
details.content: 410 deaths and highest single-day spike of 19,906 new #COVID19 cases in last 24 hours. Positive cases in India stand at 5,28,859 including 2,03,051 active cases, 3,09,713 cured/discharged/migrated & 16,095 deaths: Ministry of Health & Family Welfare

details.title: Barber shops, salons reopen in Mumbai
details.content:
Maharashtra: Barber shops & salons reopen in Mumbai. An owner says, "I thank govt for allowing us to reopen. We sanitise every equipment before their use. Salon is also sanitised every 2 hours."

There are 27,134 active cases of #COVID19 in Mumbai, as per last night's bulletin. pic.twitter.com/gJ5fsg0r7X

— ANI (@ANI) June 28, 2020

details.title: 82 lakh samples tested up to June 27
details.content:
The total number of samples tested up to 27 June is 82,27,802 of which 2,31,095 samples were tested yesterday: Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) pic.twitter.com/QoDYvLrnBC

— ANI (@ANI) June 28, 2020

details.title: Buses, autorickshaws ply on roads as Kerala govt suspends lockdown on Sundays
details.content:
Kerala: Buses and autorickshaws ply on roads in Kottayam as state government suspends complete lockdown on Sundays. The state will continue to observe night curfew from 9pm to 5am on all days. pic.twitter.com/K1wV1Q7Ty5

— ANI (@ANI) June 28, 2020

details.title: COVID-19 containment zones now 417 in Delhi; nearly 2.45 lakh people screened so far
details.content: The number of COVID-19 containment zones in Delhi has risen to 417 after re-mapping of such areas, while around 2.45 lakh people have been screened in a mammoth exercise to check the spread of COVID-19 in the national capital, officials said on Sunday. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Maharasthra CM to address state at 1.30 pm on lockdown
details.content:
Maharashtra chief minister Uddhav Thackeray will address the state today at 1.30 pm. More clarity whether the lockdown will continue or end or more relaxations in terms of travel , business etc. The war against #COVID19 continue @CMOMaharashtra @Sunday_Standard @NewIndianXpress

— Sudhir Suryawanshi (@ss_suryawanshi) June 28, 2020

details.title: We have to be more cautious during unlock phase, follow norms, says PM Modi
details.content:
Modi while assuring India is doing everything in power to fight the coronavirus said 'people are commonly talking about one thing- when will 2020 end. They feel it has been a year of many challenges. There could be any number of challenges but our history shows that we've always overcome them. We've emerged stronger after challenges.

(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: We have to be more cautious during unlock phase, follow norms, says PM Modi
details.content:
Modi while assuring India is doing everything in power to fight the coronavirus said 'people are commonly talking about one thing- when will 2020 end. They feel it has been a year of many challenges. There could be any number of challenges but our history shows that we've always overcome them. We've emerged stronger after challenges.

details.title: Former Gujarat CM tests positive for coronavirus
details.content: A former chief minister of Gujarat has tested positive for coronavirus, his aide said on Sunday. He was suffering from fever for last three-four days and was quarantined at his home in Gandhinagar under doctor's guidance, he said. "He tested positive for coronavirus on Saturday and was shifted to a private hospital on Sunday morning on the advice of his doctor," the aide said.

details.content:

details.title: TN govt issues procurement order for Remdesvir, Enoxaparin vials
details.content: TN govt issues procurement order for 42,500 Remdesvir (100 mg) vials of Enoxaparin (40 mg) injection medicines.

details.title: There is no community transmission in Dehi: Amit Shah
details.content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that remarks made by Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia in early June about the national capital reaching 5.5 lakh COVID-19 cases by the end of July had created "fear" among people and he expressed confidence that the stage will not be reached. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Lockdown will not be extended in Maharashtra: CM Uddhav Thackeray
details.content:
Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray announced, they have no plan to extend the lockdown. If #Covid_19 cases increases then local administration will take call . He said now people has to decide whether they want 2 extend lockdown or not @NewIndianXpress @Sunday_Standard

— Sudhir Suryawanshi (@ss_suryawanshi) June 28, 2020

details.title: Biggest plasma therapy centre to come up in Maharashtra: CM
details.content:
Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray said that they will start the India's biggest Plasma therapy centre in state. He also appealed particularly people who got cured from #COVIDI19, to donate the blood for the plasma therapy. @NewIndianXpress @Sunday_Standard

— Sudhir Suryawanshi (@ss_suryawanshi) June 28, 2020

details.title: 813 new cases in AP take state tally past 13000
details.content:
It is the highest number of cases reported on a single day till now. In all 25,778 samples were tested of which 755 cases were reported locally, 50 from those who returned from other states, and 8 among those who returned from other countries.  

FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: Spike in domestic violence and suicide cases seen in Ludhiana during lockdown
details.content: Suicide and domestic violence cases have increased during lockdown in Ludhiana, Punjab. Sixty suicide cases and 850 complaints of domestic violence were reported before lockdown this year. During lockdown, 100 cases of suicide and 1500 domestic complaints have been registered: DCP Akhil Chaudhary

details.title: Shopping malls to reopen in Gurugram and Faridabad from July 1
details.content: Shopping malls will re-open in Gurugram and Faridabad districts from July 1 following the Standard Operating Procedure (SOPs) issued by the central government: Haryana Government

details.title: Case against Baba Ramdev in Jaipur
details.content:
We had received multiple complaints against Baba Ramdev for allegedly claiming to have developed medicine for coronavirus, without any trial. So, we've registered a case against Ramdev, Balkrishna & others on a complaint lodged by an advocate: Jaipur ACP Ashok Gupta #Rajasthan pic.twitter.com/iNv7HdC3p9

— ANI (@ANI) June 28, 2020

details.title: Ban exams, online tests are discriminatory: Kapil Sibal
details.content: Universities should not conduct exams amid COVID-19 pandemic, online tests discriminatory. With a big part of academic year lost due to COVID pandemic, Class 10 board exams should not be held next year: Ex-HRD minister Kapil Sibal

details.title: Intense lockdown skyrockets vegetable prices in Chennai markets
details.content:
As Chennai went under an intense lockdown on Sunday, prices of vegetables in the retail markets doubled with tomato, potato and onions burning a hole in the customer's pockets. To add to the woes, over the last 20 days, prices of vegetables like beans, cluster beans and coriander have also increased.  

FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: Door-to-door survey under 'Kill Corona' drive from July 1 in Madhya Pradesh
details.content: The Madhya Pradesh government will launch a 'Kill Corona' campaign from July 1 to control the spread of COVID-19 in the state. Under the campaign, door-to-door survey will be conducted and tests would also be done on citizens for other diseases, Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said during a virtual review meeting on the COVID-19 pandemic on Saturday.

We have decided to extend the lockdown in Manipur for another 15 days from 1st-15th July: State Chief Minister N Biren Singh pic.twitter.com/g17Gt63uZi

details.title: Bengal not included in migrants' job scheme as TMC govt didn't give data: FM
details.content: Criticising the TMC dispensation in West Bengal for allegedly opposing pro-people policies of the Centre, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Sunday said the state could not be made a beneficiary of the 'Garib Kalyan Rojgar Abhiyaan', as it had not provided any data on migrant labourers. Addressing a virtual rally for the people of Bengal, the Union finance minister also slammed Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee for "her reluctance to allow Shramik Special train services in the state".

details.title: Delhi reports 2889 new cases, tally crosses 83,000
details.content:
Delhi registers 2889 new #COVID19 cases on Saturday taking cumulative cases above 83K and active cases more than 27K.
3306 patients recovered in past 24 hours, more than fresh detected cases.
20K + tests conducted@NewIndianXpress @TheMornStandard #coronavirus pic.twitter.com/REDAlxohUw

— Somrita Ghosh (@Somrita_Ghosh) June 28, 2020

details.title: Himachal Pradesh COVID tally
details.content: Total number of COVID19 positive cases in Himachal Pradesh are 902 including 367 active cases, 515 recoveries and 7 deaths: State Health Department

details.title: COVID update from Dharavi
details.content: 13 new COVID-19 positive cases have been reported from Dharavi area of Mumbai today, taking the total number of cases to 2245. Death toll stands at 81: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation

details.title: Six more ITBP men test positive for coronavirus
details.content: 6 more personnel of Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) tested positive for COVID-19 in the last 24 hours. There are total 90 active cases & 223 have recovered till date: ITBP

details.title: Final semester exams postponed in Punjab universities till July 15
details.content: Punjab Chief Minister Amarinder Singh made the announcement while responding to concerns expressed by students and parents on the conduct of examinations amid the COVID-19 pandemic. The final decision on the subject will, however, be subject to the new directions/guidelines expected to be released by the University Grants Commission (UGC) any time, a state government release said.

details.title: 17 Karnataka students who wrote SSLC exam with COVID-19 positive student, test negative
details.content: It came as a big relief when 17 students who wrote the Secondary School Leaving Certificate (SSLC) exams along with a student who was infected with coronavirus, tested negative for the virus. (READ MORE)

details.title: Supreme Court dismisses plea seeking cancellation of remaining Class 10 Rajasthan state board exams
details.content: The Supreme Court on Sunday in an urgent hearing dismissed a plea seeking cancellation of the remaining two Class 10 examinations scheduled to be held on June 29-30, to be conducted by the board of secondary education of Rajasthan, said a lawyer appearing for the state government. (READ MORE)
